title: Quick Notes: Showmatch Showdown
body: Hey NA LCS fans! Dave “RumbleStew” Stewart here—I’m the Executive Producer of the NA LCS. To continue our Quick Notes series, I’m here to talk about why we do showmatches, how we picked this year’s theme, and go behind the scenes of how we make showmatches.

replies.body: Please turn All-Stars back into this sort of fun silly competition. Worlds for skill, all-stars for memes.
Yea last All Stars was basically diet worlds. This, on the other hand, is what All Star's should have been.

ya... not that I don't like watching top end competition, but we have enough serious competitive events. Split finals for each region, Worlds, MSI, and, to a lesser degree, Rift Rivals satisfy that itch thoroughly. What we need is more fun, silly things. Things for us to watch and laugh at, things to remind the pros that this is a game and it can be fun.

I didn't even watch last All-Stars. I had had enough hyper-competitive League and simply was not interested. I've watched every all-stars where they had all the silly events. Because those are a fun change of pace.
Glad you enjoyed the show. Thanks for the feedback.
Has TSM finalized ClakeyD's contract yet?

Everything needs a good storyline to make for the showmatch. It's how we had some interesting matters like Ibai vs Quickshot or even Rusty vs YamatoCannon; both all stars references but the point stands. I can imagine each year is a bit of a strain, especially with every region having their own thing to put on the table. But I do have to admit: ASE would be the place to produce the more heated showmatches whatever they may be.
This was very funny. Really enjoyed it!
My only gripe was it was too short! I loved this! I particularly enjoyed seeing the casters play for a change.
This should be twice a year.  Halloween and Thanksgiving would be the best bet. (since Worlds is in October).
